title: Spinach and Feta Stuffed Bell Peppers
steps: Preheat the oven to 375°F (190°C). Cut the tops off the bell peppers and remove the seeds and membranes. Set aside.

Heat olive oil in a skillet over medium heat. Sauté the diced onion and garlic until soft (about 3 minutes). Add chopped spinach and cook until wilted (about 2 minutes). Remove from heat and mix in cooked quinoa/rice, feta cheese, oregano, salt, and pepper.
Fill each bell pepper with the spinach and feta mixture. If desired, top with a small spoonful of tomato sauce.
Place the stuffed peppers in a baking dish. Cover with foil and bake for 20 minutes. Remove the foil and bake for an additional 5-10 minutes until the peppers are tender.
Allow to cool slightly and serve warm.

title: Eggplant Parmesan
steps: Slice the eggplants into ½-inch rounds, sprinkle with salt, and let them sit for 10 minutes to draw out moisture. Pat dry.
Place flour, beaten eggs, and breadcrumbs (mixed with Italian seasoning) in separate bowls. Coat each eggplant slice in flour, dip in egg, then coat in breadcrumbs.
Heat olive oil in a skillet over medium heat. Fry the breaded eggplant slices until golden on both sides (about 3 minutes per side). Drain on paper towels.
Spread a thin layer of marinara sauce in a baking dish. Layer eggplant slices, marinara sauce, mozzarella, and Parmesan. Repeat until all ingredients are used.
Preheat oven to 375°F (190°C). Bake for 20-25 minutes until bubbly and golden. Serve warm.

title: Sweet Potato and Black Bean Tacos
ingredients: 2 medium sweet potatoes, peeled and diced
1 can black beans (15 oz), drained and rinsed
Optional toppings: avocado, salsa, sour cream, cilantro
steps: Heat a skillet over medium heat with 2 tablespoons of olive oil. Add diced sweet potatoes, paprika, cumin, salt, and pepper. Cook for 10-12 minutes, stirring occasionally, until tender.
Stir in black beans and cook for an additional 2 minutes until heated through.
Warm the tortillas and fill with the sweet potato and black bean mixture. Add toppings as desired.

title: Broccoli and Cheddar Soup
ingredients: 1 ½ cups shredded sharp cheddar cheese
steps: Melt butter in a large pot. Sauté onion and garlic until soft (about 3 minutes). Add broccoli and cook for 5 minutes.
Stir in flour and cook for 1 minute. Gradually add vegetable broth while stirring. Simmer for 15 minutes until broccoli is tender.
Use an immersion blender to puree the soup (or transfer to a blender). Return to the pot and stir in milk/cream and cheese. Season with salt and pepper. Serve warm.

title: Garlic Butter Shrimp Pasta
steps: Boil water in a large pot, add salt, and cook the spaghetti according to package instructions. Reserve ½ cup of pasta water before draining.
In a large skillet, melt butter over medium heat. Add garlic and red pepper flakes, cooking for about 1 minute. Add shrimp and cook for 2-3 minutes per side until pink and opaque.
Add the cooked spaghetti to the skillet with the shrimp. Toss with parsley, lemon zest, and juice. If needed, add reserved pasta water to adjust the sauce consistency.
Season with salt and pepper, garnish with additional parsley, and serve immediately.

title: Caprese Salad with Balsamic Glaze
ingredients: 2 large balls of fresh mozzarella, sliced
steps: Arrange slices of tomato, mozzarella, and basil leaves on a plate in an alternating pattern.
Drizzle with balsamic glaze and olive oil. Sprinkle with salt and pepper. Serve immediately.

title: Lemon Garlic Salmon
steps: Set oven to 375°F (190°C).
In a bowl, mix garlic, lemon juice, olive oil, dill, salt, and pepper.
Place salmon fillets on a lined baking sheet. Brush with marinade. Bake for 12-15 minutes until cooked through. Serve with lemon wedges.

title: Beef Wellington with Red Wine Reduction
steps: Preheat the oven to 400°F (200°C). Season the beef tenderloin generously with salt and pepper. Sear it in a hot skillet until browned on all sides (about 2 minutes per side). Let cool and brush with Dijon mustard.
Sauté mushrooms, onion, and garlic in a skillet over medium heat until moisture evaporates and mixture is paste-like. Cool completely.

Lay prosciutto slices on a sheet of plastic wrap, overlapping slightly. Spread the mushroom mixture evenly on top. Place the beef in the center and tightly roll it up using the plastic wrap. Chill for 15 minutes.
Roll out puff pastry. Remove the plastic wrap and place the beef in the center. Wrap the pastry around the beef, sealing edges. Brush with beaten egg and make small slits for ventilation.
Place the wrapped beef on a baking sheet and bake for 35-40 minutes or until the pastry is golden brown and internal temperature reaches 125°F (medium rare). Rest for 10 minutes before slicing.
In a saucepan, reduce red wine and beef stock over medium heat until thickened. Whisk in butter for a glossy finish. Add cornstarch if needed.
Slice the Beef Wellington and drizzle with red wine reduction.

title: Seafood Paella
steps: Sauté chicken and bell pepper in olive oil over medium heat. Add rice, saffron, and smoked paprika, stirring until the rice is coated and slightly toasted.
Stir in chicken or seafood stock and diced tomatoes. Cook over low heat for 20 minutes, stirring occasionally, until the rice absorbs most of the liquid.
In the last 10 minutes, add shrimp and mussels on top of the rice. Cover and cook until the shrimp turn pink and the mussels open.
Serve hot, garnished with parsley or lemon wedges, if desired.

title: Duck à l'Orange
steps: Score the skin of the duck breasts in a crisscross pattern. Season both sides with salt and pepper.

Heat a skillet over medium heat and place the duck breasts skin-side down. Cook for 6-8 minutes until the fat renders and the skin is crispy. Flip and cook the other side for 2-4 minutes. Remove and rest.
In the same skillet, pour out excess fat, then add orange juice, honey, balsamic vinegar, and chicken stock. Simmer until reduced to a thick sauce.
Return the duck to the pan for 1-2 minutes to coat in the sauce. Serve the duck sliced with the sauce drizzled over the top, garnished with orange zest.

title: Coq au Vin (Chicken in Red Wine)
steps: Sear chicken thighs in butter until golden. Set aside.
Sauté onions, garlic, and carrots until soft. Stir in tomato paste and flour and cook for 1 minute.
Add red wine and chicken stock, then return the chicken to the pot. Simmer on low heat for 1.5 hours.
Add mushrooms in the last 30 minutes of cooking. Serve with mashed potatoes or crusty bread.

title: Vegetarian Stuffed Peppers
steps: Cook quinoa according to package instructions.
Sauté onion, garlic, and tomatoes.
Mix cooked quinoa with sautéed vegetables.
Stuff the bell peppers and top with cheese.
Bake at 375°F for 25 minutes.

title: Creamy Mushroom Risotto
steps: Sauté mushrooms, onion, and garlic in butter.
Add Arborio rice and cook for 2 minutes.
Gradually add vegetable stock while stirring.
Cook until rice is creamy and tender.
Stir in Parmesan cheese and season with salt and pepper.

title: Quick Garlic Shrimp
steps: Melt butter in a skillet.
Add garlic and cook until fragrant.
Toss in shrimp and cook until pink.
Season with salt, parsley, and lemon juice.

title: 5-Minute Avocado Toast
steps: Toast the bread.
Mash avocado and spread it on the toast.
Sprinkle with salt, pepper, and chili flakes.

title: Ratatouille
steps: Thinly slice all vegetables.
Layer vegetables in a baking dish in a circular pattern.
Drizzle with olive oil and sprinkle with thyme, salt, and pepper.
Bake at 375°F for 50 minutes.

title: Lamb Rogan Josh
steps: Marinate lamb with yogurt and spices for 1 hour.
Sauté onions, garlic, and ginger until golden.
Add marinated lamb and cook until browned.
Add tomatoes and simmer for 1 hour.
Finish with garam masala and serve with rice or naan.
